abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Emergency Power
            Rehabilitation Project for Afghanistan is to provide an
            improved and more reliable power supply to the people in
            Kabul. Initially, project implementation had been very slow.
            In December 2006, the project was restructured to: (i)
            reduce the scope of part A of the project to rehabilitate
            and expand the core medium voltage network in Kabul and
            reallocate credit proceeds to finance critical parts of the
            northern transmission system to allow the import of lower
            cost power from neighboring countries to supply Kabul (an
            added part G of the project); (ii) outsource project
            management to a consulting firm to mitigate project
            implementation delays; (iii) revise the project's
            outcome indicator to increased grid supplied power
            consumption by customers in Kabul by 70 percent at the end
            of the project; and (iv) extend the credit closing date by
            20 months from January 31, 2009 to September 30, 2010.
